formattedAddress: 150 E 14th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 150 E 14th St, New York, NY 10003-4170, USA

editorialSummary.text: Local chain offering Korean BBQ grilled tableside & ban-chan in a trendy, modern setting.

originalText.text:
I had much better Korean BBQ in Flushing, K town or even in NJ.   Let me describe what didn't live up to the norm for Korean BBQ in NYC.

Food quality, the appetizers were greasy and deep fried, like fried frozen foods.   The food quality was sacrificed by the all-you-can-eat price.    The meats were not even evenly marinated, and they came out as big tangled blobs.  The meats were full of gristle.

The restaurant looks new and modern at first sight, and then you realized some vents were not working here.   When it gets busy, that unpleasant cooking grease gets baked into your body and clothing.    A few vents are visible not working.

This is not a Korean BBQ spot for me!  I give the place three stars for its location and great service provided by Rachel today, not the others.

originalText.text:
So happy to have just found this spot for All You Can Eat KOREAN BBQ in Union Square! We got 2 hours of unlimited KBBQ for just $27.95 - kind of unheard of for this area.

My friends had never tried Korean BBQ before so I had to take them to this spot with numerous options of quality meat at an affordable price point! We tried literally everything on the menu, the beauty of AYCE! They were very happy by the end of this meal!

originalText.text:
Amazing staff!

Went on a busy day so my friends & I waited for an hour.  Well worth the wait!

The food was delicious & flavorful overall!

Reason not a five star is the chicken should be better quality & the way they serve water out of plastic jars & plastic cups.

Amazing experience overall & highly recommend!!

originalText.text: This BBQ restaurant was different from the others. They had a lot of seating availability, so I didn't have to wait at all. Very structured interior with the fume hoods. Some of the menu items were ambiguously translated in Korean and I had to look it up. I really loved the staffs' attentiveness to every customer and how they were looking in on tables when to change the pan. I do think that the price is really reasonable with the variety of drinks provided (not included in all-you-can-eat package). However, as I was looking around, I found that only chopsticks were provided and saw a lot of customers were stressed that it was hard for them to eat rice with the chopsticks. I would recommend having spoons and/or forks on the table, but not something for the customers to request.

originalText.text: Decided to visit Gen on a Friday night and I wasn’t disappointed. There was a bit of a wait but the waitlist app was easy to use. The text and phone call was received and once at the host desk we were instructed to scan the menu QR code before being seated. Our waitress Rachel was amazing. PS. 2 hours is more than enough time to enjoy the all you can eat option.
